messages.original: Deepstate reports that Russia carried out a series of mechanised assaults in the Orikhiv direction, western Zaporizhzhia Oblast, today.   They stated that Russian forces, using tanks, BMPs, BTRs, and infantry attacked on four assault vectors towards Mala Tokmachka‚Ä¶

Update: A Russian channel with connections on the frontline claims that Russian soldiers entered Novodanylivka (south of Orikhiv).
Keep in mind, all previous Russian attempts to gain a foothold in the village have failed, but this attack does seem to be much larger.
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
A secondary target has also been hit. 4 KABs impacted the power plant, and 4 others impacted something else. The KABs have been launched in two waves so far, 2 hitting each target at a time.
High threat of Iskander launches from Kursk
Iskander on Richky, Sumy Oblast
Two missiles were detected, both S-300 air defence missiles. No Iskander threat.
Three S-300 missiles (ground-to-ground) struck the Bilopillya area in Sumy Oblast
A Su-34 is flying to the launch lines in Kherson Oblast from Dzhankoi, Crimea. KAB launches to Ukrainian-controlled Kherson Oblast are expected in the next 15 minutes.
Three S-300 missiles (ground-to-ground) struck the Bilopillya area in Sumy Oblast
Bilopillya District continues to be shelled by S-300s. 2+ more impacts.
A Su-34 is flying to the launch lines in Kherson Oblast from Dzhankoi, Crimea. KAB launches to Ukrainian-controlled Kherson Oblast are expected in the next 15 minutes.
The combat mission was cancelled for some reason. 5 (!) Su-34s flew to the launch lines northwest of Chaplynka, Kherson Oblast, and made a return flight to Crimea.

Kherson City is currently under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones. At least four impacts have been recorded in the Tavriya District. 
1 reconnaissance drone is operating over the Dnipro River, opposite Korobelnyi Island.
The combat mission was cancelled for some reason. 5 (!) Su-34s flew to the launch lines northwest of Chaplynka, Kherson Oblast, and made a return flight to Crimea.
The 5 Su-34s flew something like this while the Gerans were striking Kherson. Very weird.
The 5 Su-34s flew something like this while the Gerans were striking Kherson. Very weird.
Also there were no Su-35 escorts for some reason.

Regarding the Geran-2 drone strikes on Kherson, here are some videos showing the impacts. Ukrainian air defence in the city attempted to shoot them down but was ineffective. The target was something in the Tavriya District, but I'm not sure exactly what. It doesn't seem to be energy-related.
More Gerans were launched from Hvardiiske Training Ground in Crimea earlier. They may also strike Kherson in the coming hours.

Regarding the Geran-2 drone strikes on Kherson, here are some videos showing the impacts. Ukrainian air defence in the city attempted to shoot them down but was ineffective. The target was something in the Tavriya District, but I'm not sure exactly what. It doesn't seem to be energy-related.
More Gerans were launched from Hvardiiske Training Ground in Crimea earlier. They may also strike Kherson in the coming hours.
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
Correction: Only one KAB targeted the power plant. 3-4 others hit something outside the city limits, while 3 more were shot down by air defence missiles.
Earlier, the Honcharivske Training Ground in Chernihiv Oblast was targeted by two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles. Now, at least 10 Geran-2 drones are flying in its direction.
Military Situation In Ukraine On October 20, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On October 20, 2025 (Maps Update)

Beyond the Front Lines: How Ukraine‚Äôs Training System Challenges Mobilized Soldiers
Ukrainian conscripts face training hell. Surviving until deployment to the front line is becoming increasingly challenging. This is not because of the intensive and difficult training process, however.
Since the beginning of the conflict in Ukraine, Kyiv has faced one of the most challenging tasks of our time: recruiting well-trained reinforcements for units and formations on the front line. The Ukrainian authorities‚Äô tactics in this regard are constantly changing, as is the nature of the fighting.
In the early stages of the conflict, in 2022, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy distributed weapons to the population in an attempt to stop the Russian advance. Territorial defence units, equipped only with light weapons, were formed in haste. Amidst the prevailing panic and lack of clear command, there were frequent incidents in which the territorial defence forces mistakenly attacked AFU soldiers...
üëâ

MOSCOW'S EASTERN PUSH: POKROVSK NEAR ENCIRCLEMENT AS UKRAINIAN FRONT SHOWS STRAIN

Bridgehead On The Yanchur: Russian Troops Expand Control On Western Bank
The Russian Armed Forces have crossed the Yanchur River once again and established control over part of a settlement on the left bank. Ukrainian reinforcements are being deployed to southern Vovchansk in an attempt to maintain the bridgehead. In Pokrovsk, Russian units have seized the railway station.
German publication suggests that the concept of 'reparation bonds' could have a negative impact on taxpayers in EU member states.
Read more 
HERE

Russia Keeps Up Strikes ‚Äî Kyiv Forced to Seek Billions for Gas
On October 19-20, Russian forces carried out a series of strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and transportation infrastructure. A key target was also the maritime oil terminal ‚ÄúYuzhny‚Äù in the Odesa region.
Due to the intensification of Russian strikes on gas infrastructure and extraction fields since the beginning of October, Ukraine intends to import significant volumes of gas to offset the resulting loss of domestic gas production.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky highlighted an urgent need for funding to purchase gas for the upcoming winter, estimating the requirement at $2 billion. He pointed to potential supplies from Greece, Slovakia, Azerbaijan, as well as agreements on liquefied natural gas (LNG) deliveries from the United States.
‚ÄúWe have found part of the funding: Norway [will provide] a $100 million grant and will allocate another tranche in January."
üëâ
